data.text:
The Swedish Academy announced on November 13, 1947 that Andre Gide, the French author, had been awarded the Nobel Prize for Literature for 1947. In announcing the award the Swedish Academy said that it was being given to M. Gide "for his extensive and artistically important authorship, in which he has exposed the problems and conditions of mankind with fearless love of truth and psychological perception." In this image Andre Gide , the French authorwrites at his desk in Neuchatel, Switzerland on November 14, 1947. (AP Photo)

Captions are provided by our contributors.
